v.v: A declaration about Babylon, that Isaiah son of Amoz received:
On the bare mountain set up a signal flag, cry aloud to them,
I have commanded my holy ones,
The noise of a multitude in the mountains, as of many people!
They come from a far country, from way over the horizon.
Howl, for the day of Yahweh is near; it comes with destruction from the Almighty.
Therefore all hands hang limp, and every heart melts.
They will be terrified; pain and agony will seize them, like a woman in labor.
See, the day of Yahweh comes with cruel wrath and overflowing anger,
The stars of heaven and the constellations will not give their light.
I will punish the world for its evil and the wicked for their iniquity.
I will make men more rare than fine gold and mankind harder to find than the pure gold of Ophir.
Therefore I will make the heavens tremble, and the earth will be shaken out of its place,
Like a hunted gazelle or like a sheep with no shepherd,
Every one who is found will be killed, and every one who is captured will die by the sword.
Their infants also will be dashed in pieces before their eyes.
Look, I am about to stir up the Medes to attack them,
Their bows will strike down the young men;
Then Babylon, the most admired of kingdoms, the splendor of Chaldean pride,
It will not be inhabited or lived in from generation to generation.
But wild animals of the desert will lie there. Their houses will be full of owls;
Hyenas will cry in their fortresses, and jackals in the beautiful palaces. Her time is near, and her days will not be delayed.
